citation.article-title: Tamlana agarivorans sp. nov., isolated from seawater off Jeju Island in Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tamlana agarivorans sp. nov.
Tamlana agarivorans (a.ga.ri.vo′rans. N.L. n. agarum agar, algal polysaccharide; L. v. vorare to devour, to digest; N.L. part. adj. agarivorans agar-devouring).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-flagellated rods, 0.6–1.0 μm in diameter and 1.0–3.0 μm long.
Colonies on MA are circular with regular margins, flat to raised, smooth, glistening, yellow in colour and 1.0–2.0 mm in diameter after 3 days incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 10 and 38 °C, but not at 4 or 39 °C.
The optimal pH for growth is between 7.0 and 8.0; growth occurs at pH 5.0, but not at pH 4.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0.5–6 % (w/v) NaCl.
The optimal NaCl concentration for growth is approximately 2 % (w/v).
Anaerobic growth does not occur on MA or on MA supplemented with nitrate.
Hypoxanthine, xanthine and Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are not hydrolysed.
Carotenoid and flexirubin pigments are produced.
The major fatty acids (>10 % of total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0, C15 : 0 and iso-C15 : 1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 36.8 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, JW-26T (=KCTC 22176T =CCUG 55327T), was isolated from seawater off Jeju Island in Korea.
